Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2018 10:27PM 88tina88 wrote: That's great news! I'm having a radial scar removed also. Mine is scheduled for August 20th. The surgery sounds easy enough. Your situation sounds very promising. Mine is probably a little higher risk, as I'm older and my mammo report seemed inconsistent with my biopsy report. But I'm trying to stay hopeful! Surgeon said go on vacation, wait for genetic results, try to relax. :)
Posts.Title: Biopsy was this morning blueberry89 Kimc319

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2018 03:42PM 88tina88 wrote: I have a radial scar too. Myexcisional biopsy is Monday. I had a rough time after the stereotactic biopsy, I attract uncommon complications... this one has got to be better! Did you get results yet?
Posts.Title: Excision of abnormal breast tissue Kimc319 jenndenino578

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2018 02:44AM 88tina88 wrote: You have been proactive about getting to the doctor and keeping on top of things, which in my opinion makes a huge difference regardless of what is going on. You already have a cancer hospital, doctors, genetic testing, that's all so helpful. I went through a few biopsies and scary test results recently and all was benign, to my surprise... I think we tend to prepare ourselves for the worst for the sake of being prepared. I sure did! I bet you are ready for the appointment and will get plenty of info. the only thing I can think of to ask is about your general risk based on the genetics and your personal history, age, etc.. Just to help plan for the future assuming this is all benign. They might want to change your schedule for mammograms or add additional screening, etc.. Good luck!
